Add input validation and SQL sanitization (Task 1.3)

This commit implements Task 1.3 from the MCP improvements plan:
comprehensive input validation and SQL injection prevention.

New Features:
- Type-based input validation framework
- SQL injection prevention and query sanitization
- Parameter validation for all MCP tools
- Malicious input detection and blocking

- auth/input_validator.py: Input validation framework with type checking
- auth/sql_sanitizer.py: SQL sanitization and injection prevention
- auth/tool_validators.py: Tool-specific validation rules

- auth/__init__.py: Export validation modules

Validation Features:
- Type validation (string, integer, boolean, enum)
- Length constraints and pattern matching
- SQL injection detection (15+ attack patterns)
- SQL comment blocking
- Keyword whitelisting/blacklisting
- Identifier validation (space IDs, table names)

SQL Sanitization Features:
- Read-only enforcement (SELECT queries only)
- Blocked operations: INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, DROP, etc.

- Valid queries allowed: SELECT with JOINs, WHERE, ORDER BY

Security Improvements:
- Zero-tolerance for SQL comments (prevent hidden malicious code)
- Query length limits (prevent DoS)
- Identifier format enforcement
- Multi-layer validation (type -> SQL -> authorization)
